post.text: We have an important job for lawyers and law studentsâ€”but not actors. Sorry, Josh Charles. Text LAWYERS to 47246 to get started.

comment.author: Emma
comment.text: Let's have another CLINTON ECONOMY: 23 million new jobs, incomes rising at all levels, balanced budget and surplus, and more people lifted out of poverty than at any time in U.S. history.

replies.author: Megan
replies.text: Racism: While Hillary was vying for the Democratic nomination in 2008, she ran an attack ad against Barack Obama that many deemed to be racist. Clinton also claimed that she had strong support from "hard working Americans, white Americans." In the 1990s, while touting racist crime policies, she said that young black men are "super predators" who should be brought "to heel", which she later regretted. She was also an early supporter of Goldwater's presidential campaign (he pushed the racist Southern Strategy and advocated against the Civil Rights Act). Finally, Clinton actively utilized racist rhetoric to defend her husband's welfare reform in 1996.

replies.author: Tanner
replies.text: Hillary Clinton is a woman of integrity. #imwithher

replies.author: Rachel
replies.text: There was no "Clinton economy." Bill was too busy getting "serviced" in the "oral office" to oppose Newt Gingrich who was doing great work with the Contract With America. It was a Gingrich economy.
